name: Hrísey
description: Hrísey is the second-largest island in Iceland and is known as a peaceful, well-known paradise for bird watchers, with about 40 species nesting there. Located in the middle of Eyjafjörður, it features a tidy fishing village with about 150 inhabitants and offers marked hiking routes for visitors. It is connected to the mainland via a 15-minute ferry ride from Ásskógssandur, which can be ordered by phone.

opening_hours.ferry_winter: Reduced or on-demand service; certain departures require pre-booking (Approx. Sept 1 - May 31).
